titleStmt.title: Letter [187 or 163 BC]
titleStmt.author: Komanos, prominent figure under Ptolemy V and VI

msContents.summary: Official correspondence of Komanos regarding shipment to the Hermopolite nome of goods belonging to him; a first letter is followed by a second enclosed letter to Pais

msItemStruct.note: Written along the fibers; the back is blank; the fragment is broken on both sides
10 lines of writing in a proficient chancery hand with many ligatures; a different hand, that of Komanos, signs the letter; the letter has wide margins

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman through H.I. Bell, in 1926-1927; no. 60 in Bell

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: [X to Y,] greetings. If you are well, [it would be] as it ought. [I am well myself. I have appended for you the] copy of the letter to Pais the k[---], so that, knowing, [you may forward the boat safely as far] as its reception by [the people of Akoris strategos] of the Hermopolite (or Kynopolite). Take care also [of yourself.] (2 H.) Farewell. Year 18, Me[cheir--] (or Mesore).

VIII; also correction to line 5 and reinterpretation to ll. 4 and 9-10 by W. Clarysse, Ancient Society 22 (1991) 235-43, especially 241-42, on Hakoris as the name of a person.
